setup.title: How to get started with OpenAI
setup.description: Step-by-step to get your API key and start using it.

steps.title: Create OpenAI account
steps.description: Go to platform.openai.com and create an account. You can use Google, Microsoft, or email.

steps.title: Add credits
steps.description: Go to Settings → Billing and add credits. Minimum is $5. The gpt-4.1-nano model costs ~$0.10/1M input tokens.

steps.title: Generate API Key
steps.description: Go to API Keys and generate a new key. Copy and save it — it's only shown once.

steps.title: Configure in project
steps.description: Add the key to your Next.js project's .env.local. Never expose it on the frontend.

pricing.title: How much does it cost?
pricing.description: OpenAI's nano models are extremely cheap. For a portfolio, the cost is practically zero.

models.name: gpt-4.1

pricing.tip: With $5 initial credit you get thousands of conversations. Perfect for a portfolio.

apiRoute.title: API Route — The backend
apiRoute.description: The Next.js route handler that connects frontend and OpenAI.
highlights: Zod validation: separate schemas for user (max 500 chars) and assistant (max 2000 chars)
Streaming: ReadableStream that sends tokens in real time
Security: API key never exposed, rate limit detection, graceful error handling
Context window: Sends only the last 6 messages to save tokens

systemPrompt.title: System Prompt — The personality
systemPrompt.description: The system prompt defines who the chatbot is, how it behaves, and what it knows.
tips: Define clear rules: 'Speak in third person', 'Do not invent information'
Include knowledge base: real data about the dev, projects, skills
Limit scope: 'Politely redirect questions outside the scope'
Define tone of voice: professional but relaxed, with code analogies
Keep it compact: large prompts consume more tokens on each request
